content: #330 7 brickyard ln ahoy hoy designed by kate salomon somedays it can be a stretch to feel buttoned up but a comfy hat can get you to ship-shape for a last-minute dash to the bus stop with the kids or to the grocery store as quick as a wink this fun stripey slouch is reversible making it even more versatile it might help you feel ready to set sail no matter what is on the horizon size to fit child adult s/m adult l/xl finished circumference 16 18 5 21 41 47 54 cm gauge 12 sts and 23 row over 2 in / 5 cm in garter stitch and adjust needle size if necessary materials yarn 2 sks contrasting dk weight yarns 180 yds each cotton comfort aplaca elegance or mewesic needles us size 3/ 3 25 & 4 / 3 50 mm circular needles 16 in / 40 cm & dpns notions stitch marker glossary k2tog = knit two sts together st s = stitch es bor = begining of round cdd = centered double decrease - slip 2 as if to k2tog knit 1 pass the two slipped stitches over 2 sts decreased instructions with us 4 needle cast on 96 112 128 sts with german twist technique for a stretchy edge and join in the round being careful not to twist your stitches change to a us 3 needle and purl one row place a bor with same color yarn knit one row and purl one row leaving working yarn at the front of your work joining alternate color knit one row bring working yarn to the front of work between your needles and transfer the alternate yarn to the back of your work between your needles over your working yarn continuing with your alternate color purl one row leaving your working yarn at the front of your work at the end of this row continue as established knitting one row and purling one row with each color switching the placement of your yarns in between your needles after your knit row and before your purl row this will hide your floats inside the garter stitch fabric making your hat reversible when you have worked approx 2 / 5 cm change to us4 needles continue until hat measures 5 5 8 5 9 / 14 22 23 cm or desired depth from cast on edge while maintaining stripe pattern start working decrease row changing to dpns or magic loop when circumference grows too small to comfortably fit on your circular needles size small start decrease sequence at row 5 size medium start decrease sequence at row 3 size large start decrease sequence at row 1 row 1 k7 cdd k13 cdd * repeat 7 times k6 16 sts decrease 112 sts row 2 purl all sts row 3 k6 cdd k11 cdd * repeat 7 times k5 16 sts decrease 96 sts row 4 purl all sts row 5 k5 cdd k9 cdd * repeat
